hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io.Console
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOType

    public class Console
extends Object
implements IOType
    Console reads strings from the keyboard and writes strings to the console. Every string is written with a carriage return at the end.

      Closes the input stream and releases any system resources associated with it.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public boolean read(Vector<String> data)
        Reads data from from the keyboard. The data is provided by the Vector object given as an input parameter.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector in which the input data is written in a string format
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • write

        public boolean write(Vector<String> data)
        Writes data to the console. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        Specified by:
        write in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector that contains the output data in a string format
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the input stream and releases any system resources associated with it. Closing a previously closed stream has no effect.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IOType
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • main

        public static void main(String[] s)
